intro: Heliosperma rohlenae, commonly known as the Rohlen's sunspore, is a rare succulent native to the arid regions of Namibia. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to harsh environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and flies. Its leaves are typically succulent, storing water to help it survive in dry conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
